body:
Looking at the man mount page

       _netdev
              The  filesystem resides on a device that requires network access
              (used to prevent the  system  from  attempting  to  mount  these
              filesystems until the network has been enabled on the system).

This seems to be more of a tag for `mount`  rather than an actual kernel option so rclone should probably just ignore options starting with `_` - do you think that is correct @ivandeex 

The answers to this post seem to confirm that https://unix.stackexchange.com/q/169697/94054
I confirm this issue on Rocky Linux 8.4,  removing `_netdev` [and `noauto`] allows `mount` to mount the volume.

> rclone should probably just ignore options starting with `_` - do you think that is correct?

@ncw
I don't know if it's correct.
Could you point to something more official than q/a site?
As a rule of thumb, this looks sensible.
Also such a rule will keep lists of valid mount options tokens from growing further.
At any rate such a rule must be documented.

@ncw @ivandeex if it helps, the expected behaviour is called out in the rclone docs:

>standard mount options like x-systemd.automount, _netdev, nosuid and alike are intended only for Automountd and ignored by rclone.

regarding `_netdev` I believe it comes from sysvinit, it's mostly used to indicate to the init system that the filesystem is networked such that it can be mounted after the network has come up.  You can see documentation confirming this here: [man systemd.mount\(5\)](https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.mount.html#_netdev) and here: [ubuntu community wiki](https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Fstab)

I extracted this list from my system (Fedora 35)

```
akde@host $ man mount | sed -ne '/FILESYSTEM-INDEPENDENT MOUNT OPTIONS/,/FILESYSTEM-SPECIFIC MOUNT OPTIONS/p' | awk 'NF == 1 && !($1 ~ /^-/ || $1 ~ /\.$/)'
       async
       atime
       noatime
       auto
       noauto
       defaults
       dev
       nodev
       diratime
       nodiratime
       dirsync
       exec
       noexec
       group
       iversion
       noiversion
       mand
       nomand
       _netdev
       nofail
       relatime
       norelatime
       strictatime
       nostrictatime
       lazytime
       nolazytime
       suid
       nosuid
       silent
       loud
       owner
       remount
       ro
       rw
       sync
       user
       nouser
       users
       X-*
       x-*
       X-mount.mkdir[=mode]
       nosymfollow
```

> > rclone should probably just ignore options starting with `_` - do you think that is correct?
> 
> @ncw I don't know if it's correct. Could you point to something more official than q/a site?

I looked at the mount source code for linux...

I found `_netdev` defined here

https://github.com/util-linux/util-linux/blob/cb49adb703b2a0b0cb4dcad0b985e186149ce65c/libmount/src/optmap.c#L168

Which looks like the mount conmmand names all the mount options and doesn't take shortcuts :-(

I thought maybe we should just relax this check and allow options starting with `_` through. They will get passed to fusermount...

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/4c93378f0e67fd65167abbd25e0b20d668102f1f/fs/mount_helper.go#L211-L213

However that doesn't work for `cmount` at least

```
$ ./rclone -vv cmount -o _netdev s3:rclone /mnt/tmp/
[snip]
fuse: unknown option `_netdev'
```

So I guess mount must filter out all the [user space mount options](https://github.com/util-linux/util-linux/blob/cb49adb703b2a0b0cb4dcad0b985e186149ce65c/libmount/src/optmap.c#L143) before passing them to fusermount as none of them seemed to work with fusermount directly, though I couldn't find out how/where this happens in the source.

So I suppose the minimal change would be to ignore `_netdev` in the options. We might consider some/all of the [user space mount options](https://github.com/util-linux/util-linux/blob/cb49adb703b2a0b0cb4dcad0b985e186149ce65c/libmount/src/optmap.c#L143)  too. That is putting more policy into rclone which is annoying, so keeping it to the minimum would be good!

Is there a specific reason `_` is tested in `rclone/fs/mount_helper.go` ?
Given the parameters are being passed through to `mount`, leave the policy to it.

> @ncw @ivandeex if it helps, the expected behaviour is called out in the rclone docs:
>> standard mount options like x-systemd.automount, _netdev, nosuid and alike are intended only for Automountd and ignored by rclone.

It would seem that the intent was to ignore and pass through `_` options, but `mount_helper.go` didn't get the memo.

Thanks all.
I have enough data to produce a fix.

However, you will not see it fixed in 1.58
If you are affected by this bug, please postpone using mount helper.
In the end, it's a brand new feature

I have had pretty large tasks planned for 1.58 before this report landed.
Also I plan to dedicate some time to push through some very old PRs.
We already have too much, and people are waiting for months.

Fixing new bugs in LIFO order would make technical debt grow so my personal policy is FIFO
Thanks for understanding.

I think the fix for this is as simple as not checking for options starting with `_` and letting mount filter them out.

Can you give this a go? It worked in my simple tests.

[v1.58.0-beta.5892.1792d0c73.fix-5808-mount-netdev](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5808-mount-netdev/v1.58.0-beta.5892.1792d0c73.fix-5808-mount-netdev/) on branch [fix-5808-mount-netdev](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5808-mount-netdev) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Is there any reason why that isn't a good fix @ivandeex ?

@ncw
It's not so simple because `--daemon` will convert `_xxx` to `-xxx` and pass to background process.
At least this needs a thorough unit test with combinations of `_` and `-` in synthetic options
and practical test with `--daemon`.
I think this can be postponed.
